article_title: Health clinics run by anti-abortion groups sue attorney general over AB 775
article_text:
00:46 "Knitted Knockers" help women with breast cancer Pause

02:07 Mother of toddler declared brain dead: 'I know you're going to come out of this'

00:43 Parents of brain dead toddler fight to keep him on life support in Roseville

01:36 California's aid-in-dying law helps one woman reclaim a 'measure of control'

01:07 Music used to de-stress and calm dementia patients

01:17 Stebbins Cold Canyon Nature Reserve reopens after fire

01:09 Health startup incubator challenges, supports Sacramento innovators

02:49 Mental health advocate uses crayon art for self exploration

article_metadata.news-keywords: A Woman’s Friend Pregnancy Resource Clinic, Crisis Pregnancy Center of Northern California, AB 775, Pacific Justice Institute, NARAL, Kamala Harris, Jerry Brown
article_metadata.description: Reproductive health clinics run by abortion opponents moved immediately to head off enforcement of a bill signed Friday by Gov. Jerry Brown that would require the clinics to inform patients that abortion services are available elsewhere.
article_metadata.title: Health clinics run by anti-abortion groups sue attorney general over AB 775 | The Sacramento Bee
